item.title: 791C Rooks Defenders
item.description: Problem link https://codeforces.com/contest/1679/problem/C Solution For this problem, we only need position of \(x\) and position of \(y\) separately. We don’t need combine them. So use fenwick tree to store the presum of \(x\) and \(y\). The value in each node only 1 and 0. Stand for has \(x\) or haven’t \(x\). Then the answer just the \(presum(x2) - presum(x1) == x2 - x1 || presum(y2) - presum(y1) == y2 - y1\)
